docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
This page highlights my academic qualifications, research work, publications and ongoing projects.

Thank you for visiting.

docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
I am Renu Kumari, passionate about advancing knowledge in

  • Plant Biology
  • Biodiversity
  • Phytochemistry
  • Capacity building
  • Resource development and

  • Liberating knowledge from climate reports etc.

  • 🌍 Location: Delhi, India

  • 📧 Email: kumarirenu18@gmail.com
  • X: [@epiren20]
  • GitHub: rkclimate20
  • LinkedIn: Renu Kumari

docs.title: Ph.D.
docs.text:
• Institution: Under the guidance of Prof. Vinay Sharma, Banasthali University, Rajasthan and Prof. Sushil Kumar, BRIC-National Institute of Plant Genome Research (NIPGR), New Delhi
  • Year: 2013
  • Title of the thesis: Characterization of salinity tolerant morphological mutants in the medicinal-cum-ornamental plant Catharanthus roseus.
  • Subject: Biotechnology

docs.title: Project Scientist III
docs.text:
• Organization: BRIC-National Institute of Plant Genome Research, Aruna Asaf Ali Marg, New Delhi-110067
  • Year of joining: 2023

  • Responsibilities:

  • Maintainer and developer of the SWATI portal (a Compendium of Indian Women in Science), a National platform highlighting contributions of women scientists in India

  • Maintainer of #semanticClimate website and creating resources for climate knowledge
  • Internship program coordinator with #semantiCcClimate, organizing outreach (workshops and training), maintaining GitHub project of #semanticClimate and making climate knowledge accessible to all through semantic toolkits.

docs.title: Skills
docs.text:
• Programming: Python
  • Web Development: HTML, CSS
  • Data Science: Pandas, NumPy
  • Other Tools: Git, graphviz
  • Program and project management
  • Semantic technologies and AI-based text analysis
  • Science communication and community engagement
  • Workshop organization
  • Internship coordination at #semanticClimate
  • GitHub project maintenance and open-source collaboration

docs.title: Experimental Lab Techniques: (>13years including Ph.D.):
docs.text:
• Adept in all laboratory techniques; Biochemistry, Genomics and Molecular Biology
  • Cloning, purification, Phytochemistry
  • DNA and RNA extraction and many others

docs.title: Upcoming Workshop
docs.text: • 24 October, 2025 | International Open Access Week 2025 , New York Tech Libraries (Organizing workshop) Read More

docs.title: Workshop and Conferences
docs.text:
• 11 October, 2025 | Participated in the ILSI India K-FFIG Symposium on NutriGene | Enhancing Functionality of Crops & Improving Nutrition Status through Gene Editing at Sovereign Hall -1 of Hotel Le Meridien, Windsor Place, Janpath, New Delhi-110001
  • 10 October, 2025 | Participated in the Indo-Swiss Workshop on 'Research Integrity in the Age of AI' at Bharat Mandapam Convention Centre, New Delhi
  • 27 August, 2025 | Climate Quest (Explore science and philosophy of climate change in a fun and interactive way)
  • 25 August, 2025 | A Fun Science Demonstration for School Students (Learn about the characteristics of soil in farming)
  • 22-24 July, 2025 FSCI 2025 | E01_AI-Assisted Literature Review on Open Access Repositories (Virtual courses| Open Scholarship in the Age of Intelligent Automation)
  • 10-12 July, 2025 DEST Hackathon 2025 | AI for digital evidence synthesis (Two days hackathon to build evidence synthesis tool)
  • 09-10 June, 2025 The Research AI Summit | Bridging Innovation & Open Science (Two Days research summit including Hands-On DIY Sessions for AI-assisted literature review using semantic tools at NIPGR, New Delhi)
  • 25 April, 2025 AI-Assisted Literature Review at WII, Dehradun (One Day Hands-on Workshop on AI over NLP using semantic toolkits)
  • 21-23 January, 2025 Hands-on Workshop on BioAI for Research | NIPGR, New Delhi (A Three-day Workshop for automated literature review)
  • 17 October, 2024 The Tech We Want Online Summit 2024 (Demonstration of semantic toolkits), Virtual
  • Youth Science Camp on 15th November, 2018 by INYAS at National Institute of Plant Genome Research, New Delhi, India
  • Workshop on R for Genomics and Data mining organised by TIGR2ESS and Cambridge India Research Foundation at India Habitat Centre from 24th February to 1st March, 2019
  • Oral presentation in 3rd Global Congress on Plant Biology and Biotechnology at Singapore on 11-13 March, 2019

docs.title: Global Policy and Biodiversity Conventions
docs.text: Member of NGO involved in co-ordinating and organizing Biological Diversity meetings as young scientist from India in the COP 14 (Conferences of Parties to the Convention on Biological Diversity, Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt, 17-19 November, 2018)
